verses.kjv: For the law having a shadow of good things to come, and not the very image of the things, can never with those sacrifices which they offered year by year continually make the comers thereunto perfect.
verses.web: For the law, having a shadow of the good to come, not the very image of the things, can never with the same sacrifices year by year, which they offer continually, make perfect those who draw near.
verses.ct: The law was only a shadow of the good things to come — not the reality itself. That's why the same sacrifices, repeated year after year, could never make the people who offered them truly complete.

verses.kjv: For then would they not have ceased to be offered? because that the worshippers once purged should have had no more conscience of sins.
verses.web: Or else wouldn’t they have ceased to be offered, because the worshipers, having been once cleansed, would have had no more consciousness of sins?
verses.ct: If those sacrifices had actually worked, wouldn't people have stopped offering them? After all, once worshipers were truly cleansed, they wouldn't still feel the weight of their sins.

verses.kjv: But in those sacrifices there is a remembrance again made of sins every year.
verses.web: But in those sacrifices there is a yearly reminder of sins.
verses.ct: Instead, those sacrifices served as a yearly reminder that sin was still there.

verses.kjv: For it is not possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins.
verses.web: For it is impossible that the blood of bulls and goats should take away sins.
verses.ct: The truth is, the blood of bulls and goats can never take away sins.

verses.kjv: Wherefore when he cometh into the world, he saith, Sacrifice and offering thou wouldest not, but a body hast thou prepared me:
verses.web: Therefore when he comes into the world, he says, “You didn’t desire sacrifice and offering, but you prepared a body for me.
verses.ct: That's why, when Christ came into the world, he said to God, "You didn't want sacrifices and offerings — but you prepared a body for me.

verses.kjv: In burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou hast had no pleasure.
verses.web: You had no pleasure in whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin.
verses.ct: Burnt offerings and sin offerings gave you no pleasure.

verses.kjv: Then said I, Lo, I come (in the volume of the book it is written of me,) to do thy will, O God.
verses.web: Then I said, ‘Behold, I have come (in the scroll of the book it is written of me) to do your will, O God.’ ”
verses.ct: Then I said, 'Here I am — it is written about me in the scroll — I have come to do your will, O God.'"

verses.kjv: Above when he said, Sacrifice and offering and burnt offerings and offering for sin thou wouldest not, neither hadst pleasure therein; which are offered by the law;
verses.web: Previously saying, “Sacrifices and offerings and whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin you didn’t desire, neither had pleasure in them” (those which are offered according to the law),
verses.ct: First he said, "You didn't want sacrifices, offerings, burnt offerings, or sin offerings, and they gave you no pleasure" — even though the law required them.

verses.kjv: Then said he, Lo, I come to do thy will, O God. He taketh away the first, that he may establish the second.
verses.web: then he has said, “Behold, I have come to do your will.” He takes away the first, that he may establish the second,
verses.ct: Then he said, "Here I am — I have come to do your will." He sets aside the first system so he can establish the second.

verses.kjv: By the which will we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.
verses.web: by which will we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.
verses.ct: And it is through that will — through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all — that we have been made holy.

verses.kjv: And every priest standeth daily ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins:
verses.web: Every priest indeed stands day by day serving and often offering the same sacrifices which can never take away sins,
verses.ct: Every other priest stands day after day performing his duties, offering the same sacrifices over and over — sacrifices that can never take away sins.

verses.kjv: But this man, after he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, sat down on the right hand of God;
verses.web: but he, when he had offered one sacrifice for sins forever, sat down on the right hand of God,
verses.ct: But Christ offered one sacrifice for sins that lasts forever, and then sat down at the right hand of God.

verses.kjv: From henceforth expecting till his enemies be made his footstool.
verses.web: from that time waiting until his enemies are made the footstool of his feet.
verses.ct: Since that time, he has been waiting for his enemies to be made his footstool.

verses.kjv: For by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified.
verses.web: For by one offering he has perfected forever those who are being sanctified.
verses.ct: Because with that single offering, he has made perfect forever those who are being made holy.

verses.kjv: Whereof the Holy Ghost also is a witness to us: for after that he had said before,
verses.web: The Holy Spirit also testifies to us, for after saying,
verses.ct: The Holy Spirit confirms this for us. First he said,

verses.kjv: This is the covenant that I will make with them after those days, saith the Lord, I will put my laws into their hearts, and in their minds will I write them;
verses.web: “This is the covenant that I will make with them: ‘After those days,’ says the Lord, ‘I will put my laws on their heart, I will also write them on their mind;’ ” then he says,
verses.ct: "This is the covenant I will make with them after those days, says the LORD: I will put my laws in their hearts, and I will write them on their minds."

verses.kjv: And their sins and iniquities will I remember no more.
verses.web: “I will remember their sins and their iniquities no more.”
verses.ct: Then he adds, "I will remember their sins and their lawless acts no more."

verses.kjv: Now where remission of these is, there is no more offering for sin.
verses.web: Now where remission of these is, there is no more offering for sin.
verses.ct: Now where sins have been forgiven, there is no longer any need for a sin offering.

verses.kjv: Having therefore, brethren, boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus,
verses.web: Having therefore, brothers, boldness to enter into the holy place by the blood of Jesus,
verses.ct: So then, brothers and sisters, because of the blood of Jesus we can boldly enter the Most Holy Place.

verses.kjv: By a new and living way, which he hath consecrated for us, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh;
verses.web: by the way which he dedicated for us, a new and living way, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh,
verses.ct: He opened a new and living way for us through the curtain — that is, through his own body.

verses.kjv: And having an high priest over the house of God;
verses.web: and having a great priest over God’s house,
verses.ct: And since we have a great high priest over the house of God,

verses.kjv: Let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and our bodies washed with pure water.
verses.web: let’s draw near with a true heart in fullness of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and having our body washed with pure water,
verses.ct: let us come close to God with sincere hearts and complete confidence in our faith, our hearts cleansed from a guilty conscience and our bodies washed with pure water.

verses.kjv: Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; (for he is faithful that promised;)
verses.web: let’s hold fast the confession of our hope without wavering; for he who promised is faithful.
verses.ct: Let us hold tightly to the hope we profess without wavering, because the one who promised is faithful.

verses.kjv: And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works:
verses.web: Let’s consider how to provoke one another to love and good works,
verses.ct: And let us think about how we can encourage one another toward love and good works.

verses.kjv: Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is; but exhorting one another: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.
verses.web: not forsaking our own assembling together, as the custom of some is, but exhorting one another, and so much the more as you see the Day approaching.
verses.ct: Don't stop meeting together, as some have gotten into the habit of doing. Instead, keep encouraging each other — and all the more as you see the Day getting closer.

verses.kjv: For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins,
verses.web: For if we sin willfully after we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remains no more a sacrifice for sins,
verses.ct: If we deliberately keep sinning after we've received the knowledge of the truth, there is no sacrifice for sins left for us —

verses.kjv: But a certain fearful looking for of judgment and fiery indignation, which shall devour the adversaries.
verses.web: but a certain fearful expectation of judgment, and a fierceness of fire which will devour the adversaries.
verses.ct: only a terrifying expectation of judgment and a raging fire that will consume God's enemies.

verses.kjv: He that despised Moses’ law died without mercy under two or three witnesses:
verses.web: A man who disregards Moses’ law dies without compassion on the word of two or three witnesses.
verses.ct: Anyone who rejected the law of Moses was put to death without mercy on the testimony of 2 or 3 witnesses.

verses.kjv: Of how much sorer punishment, suppose ye, shall he be thought worthy, who hath trodden under foot the Son of God, and hath counted the blood of the covenant, wherewith he was sanctified, an unholy thing, and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace?
verses.web: How much worse punishment do you think he will be judged worthy of who has trodden under foot the Son of God, and has counted the blood of the covenant with which he was sanctified an unholy thing, and has insulted the Spirit of grace?
verses.ct: How much worse do you think the punishment will be for someone who has trampled the Son of God underfoot, treated the blood of the covenant that made them holy as if it were nothing sacred, and insulted the Spirit of grace?

verses.kjv: For we know him that hath said, Vengeance belongeth unto me, I will recompense, saith the Lord. And again, The Lord shall judge his people.
verses.web: For we know him who said, “Vengeance belongs to me;” says the Lord, “I will repay.” Again, “The Lord will judge his people.”
verses.ct: We know the one who said, "Vengeance belongs to me; I will repay," says the LORD. And again, "The LORD will judge his people."

verses.kjv: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
verses.web: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
verses.ct: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.

verses.kjv: But call to remembrance the former days, in which, after ye were illuminated, ye endured a great fight of afflictions;
verses.web: But remember the former days, in which, after you were enlightened, you endured a great struggle with sufferings;
verses.ct: But remember those early days after you first received the light — how you endured a fierce struggle of suffering.

verses.kjv: Partly, whilst ye were made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions; and partly, whilst ye became companions of them that were so used.
verses.web: partly, being exposed to both reproaches and oppressions; and partly, becoming partakers with those who were treated so.
verses.ct: Sometimes you were publicly insulted and persecuted. Other times you stood side by side with those who were going through the same thing.

verses.kjv: For ye had compassion of me in my bonds, and took joyfully the spoiling of your goods, knowing in yourselves that ye have in heaven a better and an enduring substance.
verses.web: For you both had compassion on me in my chains, and joyfully accepted the plundering of your possessions, knowing that you have for yourselves a better possession and an enduring one in the heavens.
verses.ct: You showed compassion to me while I was in chains, and you accepted the seizure of your property with joy, because you knew you had something better and lasting waiting for you in heaven.

verses.kjv: Cast not away therefore your confidence, which hath great recompence of reward.
verses.web: Therefore don’t throw away your boldness, which has a great reward.
verses.ct: So don't throw away your confidence — it carries a great reward.

verses.kjv: For ye have need of patience, that, after ye have done the will of God, ye might receive the promise.
verses.web: For you need endurance so that, having done the will of God, you may receive the promise.
verses.ct: You need endurance, so that after you have done the will of God, you will receive what he has promised.

verses.kjv: For yet a little while, and he that shall come will come, and will not tarry.
verses.web: “In a very little while, he who comes will come, and will not wait.
verses.ct: "In just a little while, the one who is coming will come and will not delay.

verses.kjv: Now the just shall live by faith: but if any man draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.
verses.web: But the righteous will live by faith. If he shrinks back, my soul has no pleasure in him.”
verses.ct: The righteous will live by faith. But if anyone shrinks back, my soul takes no pleasure in them."

verses.kjv: But we are not of them who draw back unto perdition; but of them that believe to the saving of the soul.
verses.web: But we are not of those who shrink back to destruction, but of those who have faith to the saving of the soul.
verses.ct: But we are not the kind of people who shrink back and are destroyed. We are the kind who have faith and are saved.
